Talk14: <sp:3:0:2:0c00>All right! What to do after this...
Talk43:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>We certainly run into each other often,
don't we? Would you like to shelter from
this rain together?
Talk15:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Don't mind me! I'm just, heh, definitely
leaving everything just as I found it!

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Wait!<sp:5:1:0> You're not with the survey team,
are you?

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Phew! I thought we were gonna get
yelled at again.
Talk44:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS_01>Hurry! I don't want to be outside when
the thunder starts!
Talk45:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:TalkPositive>So, isn't getting close up to this chunk
here something at least?

We can sweep up some of the fragments
and sneak 'em away. We gotta study
these ruins somehow...<sp:5:1:0>huh?
Talk16:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We really want to become members of
the Zonai Survey Team, so we came here
to study the ruins.
Did you know that <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> have
been found only in <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>
and nowhere else?
That's why the Zonai Survey Team sent
its <clr:0000>specialists<clr:ffff> to examine them.

We figured this was a great opportunity
to learn all sorts of things.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But Letty has been running all over the
place to look at this and that, so we've
gotten nowhere fast.
Talk46:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Naturally! Let's see how many of the <clr:0000>five
Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> we can visit to see those!
Talk17:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>So...hungry...


I'm glad there are <clr:0000>five<clr:ffff> ruins around here
to study, but it's exhausting running
between them all.
Talk47:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>But <clr:0000>Princess Zelda gave the order<clr:ffff> for
everyone to stay away from it.
Talk18:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We should cook up something refreshing.
We have <clr:0000>swift carrots<clr:ffff>, so what do you
think? <clr:0000>Carrot stew<clr:ffff>?
Talk48:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Well, we can't visit that one, by <clr:0000>order
of Princess Zelda<clr:ffff> herself. No one's
allowed to go anywhere near it.
Talk19:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oooh! Good idea!


We even have all of the ingredients...
swift carrots, goat butter, milk, and
Tabantha wheat.<sp:5:0:0> Go for it, Totsie!
Talk49:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:TalkPositive>Sure, this is only a small chunk, but it's
way easier to go hands-on with.

We can sweep up some of the fragments
here and sneak 'em away. We gotta study
these ruins somehow...<sp:5:1:0> Huh?
Talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Huh? You want me to do it? I barely know
which end to hold on a ladle.
Talk21:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Sad>I mean, compare it to the main sites, like
that <clr:0000>Ring Ruin<clr:ffff> over there. It's broken in
two, but you can still see the full ring.
Talk50:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I hear that the village chief insisted on
them being open about what they
discover.
The village is drawing a lot of tourists
because of that.

She seems pretty smart, despite only
recently stepping into her position.
Talk51: <sp:3:0:2:0b00>But I barely even know how to start a fire!
Talk22:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Well, darn. I was getting excited about
that <clr:0000>carrot stew<clr:ffff>.
Talk23:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Good evening! We certainly run into each
other often.
Talk52:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS_00>Oh! How do you even get to places that
are so high up?

I was told there were footholds, but it's
basically a cliff!

<sp:3:0:2:0000>I've heard that the Zonai Survey Team
lets you use their balloons after you
become a member.
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>After we join up, we'll be able to do that
together someday.

For now, we'll have to make our way on
foot while we study on our own.
Talk24:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Morning! We certainly run into each
other often.
Talk53:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>How great!


Kind of inspires me to make sure we study
these ruins so we become super-smart
members of the survey team!
Talk25:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hello! We certainly run into each
other often.
Talk26:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Of all the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>, I wish we could
enter that oneâ€”any part of it. And best
of all, the section that's <clr:0000>floating<clr:ffff>!
Talk27:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Aha! If the ruins fell here, then they
must have come from some place in
the sky, right?
This is amazing, Totsie!
Talk28:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>From the sky... You know, a <clr:0000>sky-island
specialist<clr:ffff> works at the huge Ring Ruin
on the northwest side of the village...
Talk31:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>What is happening? I'll just wait until this
little climbing-on-things adventure is over.
Talk32:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>The sky islands are those things just
floating in the sky, right?

I really want to ask him about what all
that is up there!
Talk04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000>Five rings<clr:ffff> fall in a village... <clr:0000>Stone slabs<clr:ffff>
bring us words from long ago... What
does it all mean?
I want to join the Zonai Survey Team so
I can help solve this mystery. But that
will have to wait...
<sp:3:0:2:0700>All the rain makes things slippery, and
then there's the thunder too. Scary!
Mysteries can wait until better weather.
Talk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>A <clr:0000>stone slab carved with writing<clr:ffff> was
discovered in each of the <clr:0000>five Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>
that fell around Kakariko Village.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I'm going to see one of them now!
Talk36:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>The ruins here are hugely important, and
the Zonai Survey Team is pretty good
about letting you know what's what.
They even let people go read the
<clr:0000>writing they deciphered <clr:ffff>on each stone
slab for themselves. Pretty great!
Talk37:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Come on! I'm sorry already.


But after we're done here...want to see
the <clr:0000>stone slab <clr:ffff>found in each of the Ring
Ruins? Huge discoveries, they say!
Talk08:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>A <clr:0000>stone slab carved with writing<clr:ffff> was
discovered in each of the <clr:0000>five Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>
around Kakariko Village.
I heard the Zonai Survey Team's leader
is making sense of all that writing.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>It's truly amazing that he can read things
that were written long, long ago!

I want to learn to read this kind of
writing someday too.
Talk38:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Then we'll just visit the Ring Ruins that
we ARE allowed to enter.
Talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000>Five rings<clr:ffff> fall in a village... <clr:0000>Stone slabs<clr:ffff>
bring us words from long ago... What
does it all mean?
I want to join the Zonai Survey Team so
I can help solve this mystery. But that
will have to wait...
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think>I'm too hungry to think right now.
Talk39:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>Four of the <clr:0000>five Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> that fell
around the village are open to visitors.
So we'll go to some of those.
Talk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think>I want to solve the mysteries of the <clr:0000>five
ruins<clr:ffff> that fell in this village and of the
<clr:0000>stone slabs<clr:ffff> here, but...<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I can't solve mysteries with an empty
stomach.
Talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><clr:0000>Five rings<clr:ffff> fall in a village... <clr:0000>Stone slabs<clr:ffff>
bring us words from long ago... What
does it all mean?
I want to join the Zonai Survey Team so
I can help solve this mystery. But that
will have to wait...
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I'm too tired to think right now. I really
need to lie down at the inn.
Talk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>We're hands on with the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> at
last! I can't believe it.
Talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Um, Letty... This chunk is just a small
piece of one of the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>. Nothing
much, really.
